result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard Thomas Cooper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Richard Thomas Cooper is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Richard Thomas Cooper was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: - Huber eligible for purposes of treatment and seek employment

- Sign up for Probation on 09/21/22
- 30 days against ultimate sentence

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
- $243.00 Court Costs, Payable through DOC as a condition of Probation in 22CM403 Count 1. 
- $200.00 DNA Surcharge, Payable through DOC as a condition of Probation in 22CM403 Count 1.

- DNA Sample
- Absolute Sobriety
- No Contact with R. Sullivan
- Maintain current treatment program
- Pay supervision fees

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard Thomas Cooper

records.addlTxt: e: DA, Atty Satorius, and DOC   c: DE and New Richmond PD   email: Jail. arc

10:53 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Richard Thomas Cooper in court.  Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Richard Thomas Cooper.  Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Satorius recites joint agreement to plea of Count 1 without repeater.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1- Resisting or Obstructing an Officer without Repeater in 22CM403. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 22CM403. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 2 and dismisses repeater enhancer in Ct 1 in 22CM403. Sentencing arguments. 

Court Orders: Ct 1 in 22CM403

I/S 6 Months County Jail- Huber authorized for purposes of treatment and seek work

1 Year Probation

- Court Costs: $243.00     
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $200.00
 Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through probation

Conditions of Probation:

- Absolute sobriety
- No Contact with R. Sullivan
- Maintain current treatment program 
- Pay supervision fees
- DE to sign up for probation today, 9/21/22

30 days credit against ultimate sentence

Adjourned at 11:18 AM. bph

9:23 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Richard Thomas Cooper in court.  Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Richard Thomas Cooper.  Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Satorius states this is close to a resolution request to schedule for a PLEAS.  DE updates address and phone number.  Bond continues. Adjourned at 9:25 AM. bph
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Richard S.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- Defendant can retrieve personal belongings from residence in the presence of Law Enforcement only. 

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

Defendant Richard Thomas Cooper in court, in custody.  Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Richard Thomas Cooper.  DE does qualify. DE updates address. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG. DE on a PO hold.
